inn1.comm: and a good one from Anderson to start with, on a tight line and shaping just across the batsman who, in his defence, just hid the bat behind the pad
but inevitably Anderson strays down the leg side, Gayle very deftly flicking it down to fine leg: Stuart Broad makes excellent ground to his left, in three galloping strides, to prevent four
oh no, Anderson's radar has run out of batteries already. This is wide of the off stump and rightly wided
Anderson follows up a wide with an absolute jaffer, as is his wont, just cutting away from Gayle's fishy waft
good grief, that's almost a Harmy: Nixon takes it in front of first slip
much better, on middle-and-off - yorker length, too, but Gayle just digs it out into the off side and scampers through for a single
drifting down the leg side this time and Anderson again hands West Indies another run
better line this time just outside the off stump, swinging into the left hander who is shouldering arms outside off
ooh at last, the right line and length. It's only taken him seven balls. This pitches just outside off stump and swings into the left hander who leaves it alone and very nearly loses his off bail
Good grief that was wide but not wided by the umpire
but that will be a wide as he drifts it down the leg side at 82mph
and Plunkett finds his line this time, swinging this into Gayle off stump who digs it out, just pushing it out into the off side
a swing and a miss from Gayle but another horrible delivery from Plunkett, albeit quicker at 84mph, well wide of the off stump
a full toss now which Gayle bangs past point, with absolutely no movement of the feet
banged into the covers with sweet timing off the front foot but Bopara is cheetah-like at cover, diving to his left to prevent a run
ah, now then, that's Plunkett's length, Smith jabbing this down on the front foot. Touch of swing into the batsman too
what a shot. A poor ball to end a disappointing, nervous first over from Plunkett, Smith crunching him on the front foot square of the wicket. No one moved.
a tighter line from Anderson, just outside the off stump and bending back in with the swing. Gayle is right back in his crease but takes a tentative step forward to defend
but a good ball is once again followed by a poor one, drifting it down Gayle's leg side who whips it in front of square leg. Broad races round from fine leg and dives, parrying the ball over the rope
cracked into the covers
pushed firmly, on the front foot, straight to mid-off who is quick to throw down the stumps at the non-striker's end, but they're safely through for a single
left alone outside off
absolutely no feet movement to one just short of a length, an ugly smite across the line brings him nothing and Anderson picks it up on his follow through
much better start to his second over, Plunkett pitching this on middle and it's cautiously defended off the back foot
that's a good one, 83.9mph and just rising on Smith, albeit too wide of the off stump to really trouble him. Plunkett's slips roar their approval, as do the crowd
that'll be another wide as Plunkett loses his line, wobbling it down the leg side
pushed out to cover and they set off for a very quick single. In comes Pietersen, I think it was, who sends in a quick throw but it's wide
oh very well bowled, angling across the left hander before holding its line just a touch. Gayle is concrete-like in the crease, aware of the movement off the pitch but he wafts at it ungainly

good grief, that's Gayle at his best, just driving through the line and timing it magnificently over long-on for six. Absolutely no movement of the feet, as is his wont, just playing it on length alone
and Gayle hammers this off the back foot into the covers but can't find the gap - that six might have woken the beast
good one to start with, showing his two more experienced bowlers the length to bowl and Smith wafts at it ungainly outside the off stump
too full from Broad this time and Smith cracks it, the ball zinging through the covers. Elegantly, confidently driven
a much better delivery on middle stump which is worked off his hip and Broad takes a giant step to his left to prevent a single
a morale victory for the bowler, hurrying the batsman who angles it down past the slips
just too short, on a pitch not offering much pace and Gayle pulls it with savagery through midwicket
audacity defined. This could be Gayle's day as he launches one over the covers, smashing it for four. It wasn't even that short but Gayle is determined not to let this young tyke settle
a filthy delivery wide of the off stump which Smith tries to flay over the slips but misses
better this time, on off stump and swinging back into the batsman who is forced to defend
much better. A jaffa, in fact, cutting across the batsman's indecisive forward poke. Nixon claps his hands, seal-like
and a no-ball which might as well have been a wide. Six of one, half a dozen of the other and so on. Smith tried to crash it over the covers but his bat was about four feet too short in length
oh magnificently driven. Smith really does have a touch of class, of lazy elegance, absolutely creaming it to Vaughan at short extra who fields it very smartly
clunked back to Plunkett who fields in his follow through
slightly wider and it's elegantly guided down past point for a single
and Gayle premeditatedly tries to pull Broad but it's a little too full, and it hammers into his boot
good response from the young bowler here, on a very good line just outside the off stump and Gayle defends
very neatly bowled indeed, almost taking Gayle by surprise. Just outside off stump but it jagged up on Gayle a touch who angles it at the last moment down to third man
yes, Broad has found his length here. An excellent ball on middle, spitting up at the batsman who is very quick to jab it away into the off side
ooh nearly. Smith is fed up with this defending malarkey, eyes up this shorter delivery but is beaten by the bounce
and he tries to smack this through the covers, the bat twisting in his hand and it's hammered into his boot
good length, but Gayle just angles it down to third man
but Plunkett lands this on leg, allowing Smith to just pluck it down to fine leg for an easy single
good grief, that is absolutely hammered by Gayle. It was a terrible delivery from Plunkett - short and wide - and Gayle just smacked it through extra cover
how on earth has he done that? Gayle gave himself room outside leg; Plunkett followed him, and it's shorter, and Gayle deliberately plays it over the slips down for four. Extraordinary shot
and this has gone! Gayle's blowing in like a storm here, just lofting this with tremendous power over long-off

and again! Gayle plants his feet, swings through the line and absolutely creams Plunkett over long-on for a quite enormous six into the Walcott stand, bouncing into the concrete steps and bouncing further into the stand
Smith tries to match Gayle's boundary-lust but misses out here, trying to cut but beaten by the bounce
extremely well bowled. This is an impressive line from Broad, just short of a length and rising up into Smith who defends it at stomach level off the back foot
oh but he loses his line and it's wided down the leg side
that's better, Smith forced to defend off the back foot out into the covers
just tucked calmly off his hip
a slow full toss which Gayle doesn't quite pick up, pushing it into the covers for Bopara to field
this jumps up a touch on Smith who plays it expertly, riding the bounce and angling to point
immediately finds the right length, Gayle just punches it to cover and sets off for a single
ah, beautifully cut - a powerful late cut, in fact, falling over to the leg side as he plays it and it fielded by third man
touch too wide from Flintoff, no great pace either as this one is guided down to third man for another single
fuller and straighter, clonked into the covers but he can't find the gap
ooh, that only fell just short of the man at point. Uppishly angled, if you like
driven on the up to backward point
outside off and hammered through point for four, all along the ground, and that's his fifty and he raises his bat and gives a massive toothy grin
opens the face and runs behind square on the off
short, cut late past the man on the 45, superbly timed and that raced across the turf. Dalrymple is dropping it too short ...
angled down the leg side, a big swing, a loud appeal, but it came off glove-pad and a single
again too leg-stumpish, turned into the gap and an ambled run
an almost mockingly correct forward defensive block from Gayle to end another productive over
squeezed down to third man, Smith ran that like a hare and got back for the second while many would have settled for the single. Gayle never broke sweat!
clipped off his legs past short midwicket
driven straight and very hard, both bowler and umpire were in danger there but neither had the time to duck as that flew past them. Taufel's evasive action was too late had it been on target
into the covers, Bopara dives but cannot prevent the run
leg stump, it kept very low and skidded into Smith's pads. Collingwood appeals but it pitched well outside leg
slower ball - at 64mph that was Panesar speed - and Smith cautiously defends
loopy and leggy, Gayle turns it to midwicket
Gayle takes a big stride down the track and has to dig out one at his feet
misread that one, pad-bat, a loud shout but the umpire remains unmoved
down the leg side, an easy call for the umpire
short, Smith leans back but doesn't time the pull and midwicket stops with ease
again Dalrymple troubles Smith who misses with his defensive prod, another loud shout but that was going over the top
no shot, the ball goes fine and the batsmen run the single before the umpire signals a dead ball
it's in the slot and Gayle slams that straight back from where it came. Jimmy Anderson at long-off only has a few yards to cover but he has no chance
firm drive to mid-off
middle-and-leg and Gayle can only turn it to midwicket, "Yeh, Colly," chirps Nixon
confidently flicked wide of midwicket, the man in the deep fields and an easy one
tip-and-run push to cover, Gayle up for it, and no problems. "One bad shot now, Colly," says Nixon
down the leg side, Nixon whips off the bails but wide all the way
Gayle misses with a nonchalant swish to leg, Nixon gets momentarily excited as it hits the pad before strangling his appeal as it pitched well outside the line
solid block, good line from Dalrymple
again on the spot, defended
short, cut behind square, Plunkett on the rope dives to stop, flicks the ball up and heads it over the boundary. Classy
pushed into the covers for an easy single
same shot, another quick run but slightly tighter
Gayle opens the face as he blocks but straight to point so no hat-trick of quick singles
on off stump, pushed to short extra cover
a little too short, Smith flips it off his hips into the leg side
Smith pushes at one outside the off stump and misses. Off come the bails as Nixon makes the most of a rare ball that beats the bat ...
again Smith misses outside off stump
fuller, firm drive to long-off and a rather disproportionate cheer from the crowd
flighted, respected, no run
good line and length, almost stopped it was so slow, but again blocked
forward and pushed into the off side
flighted and once more blocked
Smith back, the ball bounced and he ran it off the face of the bat  to short third man
cut to deep backward point for a single
full, slight drift away from the left-hander, prodded to cover
crisp drive to cover. Collingwood has done a good job of stemming the flow ... famous last words ...
turned to mid-on, wide enough for the run, but he was a bit cramped playing that shot and that's why he didn't get any power into it
Gayle waits and deliberately steers the ball down to third man
Smith caught in two minds and is turned square ... and in the end it's all he can do to squeeze the ball to third man
short outside off, Gayle shapes to hammer it through midwicket but misses. He leans on his bat in a self-admonishing way
loopy, flicked straight to midwicket
that must have been the slowest ball of the tournament ...tossed up and Smith misses a leg-side swish
patted into the covers
full toss driven to the left of Dalrymple and up to deepish mid-on
off the pads and short fine leg fields
turned across Gayle and it beats his backward defensive push
pushed to mid-off and a quick single as Flintoff a tad slow to set off to field
Gayle punches that wide of midwicket -  no power, all timing - and what looked like a single earned him four as it scorches across the outfield
slammed drive back past Collinwgood, not quite timed and Flintoff slides at long-off to prevent a brace of fours
Smith drives but utterly mistimes and short extra cover fields
Smith blocks a good-length delivery
Smith punches to Vaughan at cover. He really is struggling to find any gaps and in doing so is frustrating Gayle's desire to get on with it
tossed up wide of the off stump, clattered off the back foot but straight into the ground
nicely flighted from Vaughan, absolutely dead straight and it's padded away by Smith
on middle-and-leg this time, just slightly flatter, but Smith again can't get it away
late cut past point, very deftly played indeed
too short and wide, Smith rocks back and cuts it hard to deep extra
again just short of a length, Gayle punches it to cover for another sublime single
slashed through the covers, without much timing
nicely bowled, just short of a length. Smith defends it out to cover
and very well bowled, angling it across Smith who tried to break the shackles by smashing him through cover. Inevitably, he missed
angled out to point
and he comes forward, guiding this down to third man to get Gayle back on strike...
full, fast, spearing into his off stump and Gayle is forced to defend it on the back foot. No single on offer there
but Anderson starts well, full and straight, and it's defended - or rather dug out - to mid-off
just short of half-volley-length but Smith drives it elegantly, comfortably through the covers, although didn't quite time it as well as he might
but no, it's full...but a touch too wide and angled down to third man
oh very well bowled. A ball which Mick Jaggered away from Gayle who squirted it out to cover
where's this gone? It's slashed high down to third man...Plunkett makes excellent ground to his left but is one stride too short, and the ball slips through his hands as he dives
cracked out to cover
starts well, cutting back into Gayle who pushes it calmly out to cover
typical Gayle. It was a perfectly good delivery, full and straight - just a touch too short and he lofted it over long-off. A magnificently timed stroke
he has absolutely laced this on the front foot! Immense power and timing, but very little placement as it whacks into Collingwood
angling into Gayle who defends

gone! Very well caught Stuart Broad who was brought in a few yards at third man a few moments ago. It was slashed uppishly to him but he had to dive to make the final few metres...to take a very good catch
and as ever Lara skips across to the off side, defending it with an extravagant swish of the bat
edged, deliberately (I think) down past Nixon through the vacant slips for four
filthy. Down the leg side
better this time, clunked out on the front foot to cover
good ball on off stump which is firmly defended
again, swinging into Smith who again can't get it away. An improvement from Anderson here. Can he maintain it?
late cut down to third man
why is he bowling on a leg stump line? I don't know. Nor does the umpire who raises his arms - oh, he's signalling a wide...
well, Anderson really is having a nightmare now. This is well wide of the leg stump; had it been to right-hander it'd have been wided I reckon
full and straight, cracked to mid-off and they grab a single
just a touch wider and it's driven smoothly to cover
driven with greater flourish this time but again he just cannot break through
excellent ball cutting back into the batsman. But it's a no-ball
Smith comes forward to angle it down to third man for his fifty
drops this into the leg side and he scampers for a single
short of a length. In fact, it's bouncer-length, but Smith's attempted flash finds just thin air
beautifully driven on the front foot, but hit with too much power. It finds cover in a second, and there's no chance of a single
what a delivery from Anderson! Lara moved across his stumps, almost displaying all three, and Lara's plays inside the line and is comprehensively beaten
punched to mid-on
down the leg side and Lara just turns his wrists to steal a single
onto the front foot, Smith drives this just wide of mid-off who skips to his right and dives to his right to field
wide enough of the off stump and Lara just rocks back, angles it fine down to third man
too short, but Smith's struggles continue as he tries to pull, but it comes off the toe end of the bat
Lara is back and across, guiding this out to point
ah, classical Lara. Just short of a length, hammered on the up square of the wicket, timed brilliantly
quicker ball which Lara ducks underneath; Simon Taufel indicates that'll be Flintoff's one for the over
oh well bowled - well thought, Flintoff. Lara comes miles across his stumps and Flintoff angles this into his leg stump. Dug out, but only just...
Smith has a boundary! A not altogether convincing stroke, slashing this shorter delivery over point
driven back to Flintoff who sticks his right paw
down the leg side. Flicked for four. You just do not and cannot bowl there to anyone, ever.
classically cover-driven but without the timing or power Lara usually shows
very fine shot, a clubbing, agricultural smite on the front foot through mid-off
Anderson drops this a foot shorter and half a foot wider; Smith late cuts down to third man very deftly
cut to point but straight to point. A touch more bounce there for Anderson
pushed out into the off side to end the over
slashed without due concern for its uppishness down to third man
typical Lara; with so much time, he just rocks back and guides it down to third man. It all looks so easy

what a catch - a remarkable, gravity-defying catch! Smith slashed seemingly over Paul Collingwood at backward point who sprung up, swivelling as he did so, taking the ball high in the air. A quite brilliant example of athleticism and hand-eye co-ordination
swinging into the new batsman, the right-handed Samuels who is rapped on the pad and Flintoff appeals, but it's going down leg
ooh close! A touch of bounce from Flintoff, Lara opening the face of the bat and guiding it through Nixon and Strauss at a wide second slip who dived to his right but it was too wide
left alone outside off
on off stump, blocked into the covers
wide and smashed straight at cover. At 68mph - the slower ball - he's too slow to offer that kind of width
Samuels back and into line to block
blocked -  good over from Braod so far, and the pressure is on

what a desperate way to bring down the curtain on Lara's career. Samuels  pushed the ball to mid-on, called for the run, Lara answered and almost immediately Samuels changed his mind, leaving Lara stranded.
Samuels defends and stays where he is ... he has learnt his lesson but at what a cost ...
driven into the covers where Collingwood slithers to stop the ball
outside off, left alone
pushed into the off side
too wide and Sarwan cuts to the left of point and a small cheer as that gets him off the mark
Samuels back, takes it on the gloves, Sarwan calls him through for a single as it plopped into space on the leg side
A Collingwood misfield in the covers. He's allowed one or two of those, given how many runs his fielding he's saved for England
Sarwan waits and plays the ball late, running it down to third man
Samuels plays defensively. That run-out has clearly affected him, but he won't want to be heading back to the dressing-room until Lara has had a chance to calm down
Samuels pushed into the leg side, but midwicket in quickly
short, Samuels goes to pull but makes a hash of it and the ball lobs over the keeper off the top edge via his shoulder. All very messy, but two runs nevertheless
placed wide of midwicket and mid-on ambles round to field
Sarwan back and squeezes the ball to backward point
Samuels stands tall and punches that to mid-off - not a good shot as his feet were nowhere near the pitch of it and he had to reach for the ball
short outside off stump, a little extra bounce, Sarwan got a thin top edge to his cut and Nixon held a routine catch
down the leg side, arrow straight, a wide all the way
a similar line - Plunkett 's not readjusted for the left-hander - and Chaderpaul plays a subtle glance very fine
pushed into the covers
good riposte from Plunkett, Chanderpaul turned square by a good ball on off stump
into line to defend
short and wide, smashed in the air through the covers for four ...never a chance even thought it was uppish
and again ... this time hit straighter, he came to meet and and gave himself some room, and it was up and over
shorter but on target, Samuels back to defend on his toes
heaved into the leg side, deep midwicket fields. Samuels has clearly changed tactics this over
short, pulled between midwicket and mid-on, not timed and it struggled to make it two-thirds of the way to the rope. Broad's inexperience showing in this over ... but he'll learn
Samuels waits and steers the ball behind square on the off, Flintoff at third man trots round to field
superb village-green hitting, Samuels steps to leg and hammers that back over the bowler, hit with real power and six all the way
slower ball, Samuels waits and pats it into the off side and strolls the single
outside off, Chanderpaul leaves it alone
opens the face of the bat and steers that between fielders in the covers, pulled up a yard inside the rope. Class
loopy slower ball, looping all the way down the leg side and taken on the second bounce by Nixon
and a no-ball to follow, Samuels steps to leg and cracks that through straight midwicket and Flintoff's dive is to no avail as the ball still trickles over the rope
poor ball, short, and Samuels pulls that through midwicket and again the ball just has enough legs to beat the fielder
a hat-trick of fours, and that's the best of the lot - he gave himself room and cut that through point, classic text-book stuff and four all the way
Chanderpaul forward, misses, Vaughan appeals but not with any expectation
pushed back to the bowler
flicked round the corner, Pietersen at short fine leg onto it quickly
Chanderpaul looks to turn it round the corner but it plops off his pads and goes no more than a yard
pushed into the covers and finally he gets his single
flighted at 41mph and Samuels respectfully pats it back to the bowler
Slashed by Chanderpaul through second slip and it races to the rope. In fairness, Flintoff bowled that too wide so he can't feel too hard done by
better line, but Chanderpaul still cuts past a diving Collingwood at backward point and third man round to retrieve
Samuels walks to leg and squirts a yorker-length delivery to long-on
Chanderpaul leans into the drive through extra cover, classy shot but there's a man in the deep to prevent too much damage
good line and length - 85mph - and Chanderpaul defends

Flintoff shakes his head, hands on knees, as Chanderpaul opens the face, albeit with a slightly edgy feel, and steers the ball fine to third man, too fine for the man down there to have any chance of stopping it
good flight, defended. He will go for this very soon, it's too tempting
driven with some power to deep cover, well hit and had he been able to place it five yards either side of the man out on the rope he would have got four
turned to short fine leg,  Samuels had to scurry back at the bowler's end as he had come some way when Chanderpaul called "no"
smashed through square leg - Taufel had to take emergency avoidance measures to avoid become a soprano
pushed to leg for a more sedate run
placed into space on the off side
almost a yorker, and Samuels somehow plays that between his legs - not quite what he intended - and the ball just beat Bopara's desperate dive
jabbed down the ground to long-on
swished to midwicket where Vaughan makes a really good diving stop
Chanderpaul surprised by a bit more bounce, the ball smacks him on the hands and plops into the off side
turned off middle-and-leg into the on side
Samuels slashes, all very heave-ho, and a top edge arcs down to third man
pinged down the ground to long-off for a single
on leg stump, Chanderpaul just flicks it fine but it can't beat the short fine-leg
neatly turned to leg with a flick of the wrists
fuller and pushed to out to cover
timed past point for a single
a big shout from Vaughan but Chanderpaul seemed to get an inside edge. And replays show it was a fairly massive inside edge in fact. Apart from that, it was dead, Michael...
a slower ball wobbling on on leg stump which he works away to midwicket for a single, and he's looking for two, is he? No, he can't get his fifty and is right sent back
that's nicely bowled, on off stump and Chanderpaul is watchful in defence
a good line but it's too short - only fractionally so - and Chanderpaul just angles it off the face of the bat. Samuels cries "yeah yeah" and they scamper through
cracked on the front foot and there's a really excellent half-century, his second fifty of the World Cup
cut off the back foot and they fly through for a single. No they don't..Samuels sends Chanderpaul back
a dibbly dobbler which is defended back to the bowler
fuller and straighter, it's pushed down all along the ground to long-on
nicely bowled, just tossing this up and giving it a little bit more air. Chanderpaul pushes it to the off side
tries to sweep but can't get hold of it
but he does get hold of the sweep this time, fast hands timing the ball neatly to deep backward square leg
oh, a tame dismissal from Samuels really. A leg-side drifter but Samuels couldn't lift it over Collingwood at short midwicket who held on to a stinger
too short from Vaughan and pulled around the corner
pushed through midwicket for a couple
late cut down to third man for a cheeky single
that's well bowled on off stump and Chanderpaul defends
again it's defended on the off stump. Good, tight bowling here on a very good length

oh, that's ridiculously well played. Sublime. A check-driven four - nothing more than a defensive prod - which bisected the infield and left the two in the outfield, arrowing in from opposite directions, look a little lazy. The timing was quite remarkable there
pushed out to cover
defended back to Vaughan
Vaughan sees him dancing down the pitch and drops it a bit shorter but he's quick enough to react, is Bravo, and flings it down to fine leg for four
cut out to extra cover
on leg stump and it's timed through midwicket with a flick of the wrists
swept quite neatly through midwicket
ah well bowled - fuller and flatter and straighter, Bravo can only dig it back out to the bowler
oh and he's gone for it, slashing it high over extra cover but it falls short of Bopara at deep extra cover and they just pick up a single
flicked off his pads, aerially, and a deep and wideish mid-on runs in to field

sloppy, lazy shot from Chanderpaul, trying to loft it over the bowler's head for six. Very well bowled from Collingwood though, a little off-cutter which Chanderpaul spooned to long-on who only had to run in a metre or so, taking the ball in his lap
delicately late cut, just using the pace of the ball, but it brings him just a single
swinging into the right hander who is rapped on the pads, but he got a thick inside edge in fact. I just didn't hear it. Good job I'm not an umpire really
on the front foot it's squirted out to point but again they can't break the infield
Vaughan gets another: Bravo came down the pitch, trying to slog him over midwicket but he couldn't get on top of it, mistiming it and skying it to Dalrymple at deep midwicket who took a simple catch
a poor ball this time: a very ugly leg-side full toss which Ramdin just picked up over Collingwood at short-midwicket
with quick feet he rocks back and cuts this wider delivery to short third man
nudged off his legs for a single
nicely flighted, clunked back to Vaughan
nurdled off his pads for another quick single
an inswinging yorker - well, he attempted a yorker anyway - which is just timed on the full behind square
drifting down leg again - Flintoff not controlling the reverse swing here - and smudged through the midwicket region for another couple
fabulous shot - excellent hands from Taylor, flaying this with a flourish and opening the face of the bat to send it zinging past point
good comeback from Flintoff! A bouncer rearing up at the bowler, cutting back into him too
lofted elegantly over extra cover. That really was classily played
and a good one with which to finish the over, swinging into his off stump and threatening to ruin it. It's solidly defended
he sweeps, misses, the ball ballooning off his pad and Nixon dives to his left to take the "catch" which Vaughan appeals for. Absolutely nowhere near hitting that
fuller and flatter, clunked to a deep mid-on
oh and he's gone for it this time, bashing this full bunger into cow corner at deep midwicket. Plunkett's grazing is interrupted and he fields neatly
down the pitch he tries to send this over the covers but can't quite time it

gone this time though. Again he comes down the pitch and tries to slog it over midwicket, but he doesn't get all of it and skies it to Dalyrmple who steadies himself and takes an easy catch at deep midwicket
and it's pushed down the ground for a quick single
and he goes for an absolutely enormous heave ho, but smudges it just wide of mid-on
goddim! A good yorker which was dug out, deadening the ball...Powell wants a single but Ramdin most certainly does not...and Preston's finest kicks the ball onto the stumps
cracked out into the covers
pushed through midwicket

ah nicely bowled, an excellent yorker which bobbles off his pads. Collymore's going for a run regardless, but Flintoff scoops up the ball and throws down the stumps with casual disdain. Slick piece of work to end the innings

inn2.comm: "It'll be  a dot ball for sure," opines Gnasher. It's down the leg side and Strauss sways inside it and it's called a wide
a brute of a ball, it reared from just short of a length and a clearly surprised Strauss did well to keep it down as it struck him on the glove
again it got big and also seamed in to Strauss, all he could do was spar and the ball edged just short of first slip and wide of Ramdin's full-length dive
Stauss gets bat onto that and pushes to leg
Strauss back and has to jab down on that as it jagged back and left him cramped and rushed
prodded into the leg side. Good movement off the seam from Collymore
on leg-stump, Strauss looks to flick fine but it thumps into his pads
Strauss steers between slips and gully to third man
a mirror image of the previous ball, steered to third man
flicked off his hips, but there's a man just behind square for that very shot
drifting down the leg side, Strauss into line but he misses it and it thuds off his pads
oohs and aahs all round as Vaughan plays a checked drive and misses
super ball, again Vaughan drives at air and Ramdin collects
too straight, no movement, and Strauss turns it to fine leg. Well played and he will milk that line
off drive but not timed, only two even though he found the gap
straight, Strauss looks to turn it to leg but all he does is scoop the ball into the hands of Devon Smith at square leg. A soft dismissal
outside off and Bopara leaves it alone
Bopara again given a sighter which he can leave
Bopara into line and very correctly defends
outside off, gently swinging away from Vaughan who shoulders arms
banged in at 84mph, Vaughan stands on tip-toe to ensure he gets right over the ball and safely defends into the covers
Bopara back and pushedsto point, Bravo fumbles as Bopara calls "yes" and that enables Vaughan to come through for the quick single without any alarms
well wide and a rather airy swish is nowhere near the ball
defended into the off side
Powell drops it short, Vaughan on it quickly and belts the ball over midwicket with real vim
oops ... short and well down the leg side, a wide whichever way you look at it
neatly flicked off leg stump through midwicket
run off the face of the bat to third man
Vaughan sizes on one fired in at his leg stump, clipping it into space past midwicket
that's another big awayswinger, but it started too wide to tempt the batsman
Bopara back, dropped into the off side and he's off like a hare ... Smith in, picks up and throws but misses. That would have been one for the third umpire had he hit
Vaughan takes two steps to meet the ball and sends it high over extra cover
Vaughan turned square as he shaped to play to leg, an edge squirts in the air through the covers between two fielders
another scampered single to end the over, the pad took the pace off the ball and allowed the run
Vaughan into line to defend assuredly
yorker-length outside off, Vaughan drives off the toe of the bat and the ball bobbles to mid-on
whipped off middle-and-leg to fine leg, Bopara walked across his stumps allowing him to play that shot, but had he missed it would have been trouble for him
punched drive on the walk but no power
Vaughan stands tall and punches to mid-off
Bopara pushes gently to short extra cover

Bopara drops into the leg side, Vaughan was committed and when Bopara called no, he was stranded. Samuels was in quickly, Vaughan turned oh-so-slowly and had the throw been on target, he was gone ... but the throw was barely in the same postal district
Bopara shuffles across and is hit high on the pad, a loud appeal but he is just about okay
good comeback, a sweetly-timed on drive, well fielded in the deep
Vaughan used his feet, Corrymore followed him, the ball trickled behind the stumps and Bopara was through quickly, and Vaughan was safe even thought Ramdin threw down the non-striker's end stumps
turned to leg, stopped by the man on the 45
flicked off leg stump to long leg
better line, still flicked into the on side but square leg fields and hugs the ball as he does so
Bopara whips that from outside off stump to short midwicket
on drive, no power though
full but outside off, patted to point
Bopara stands tall and slams that between cover and extra cover
short, Vaughan attempts to pull through midwicket but misses
again too short, this time Vaughan connects and turns the ball wide of a diving square leg
Vaughan back and punches the ball wide enough of midwicket to allow an easy single
Bopara into line and very correctly and photogenically defends
overpitched, smacked back with interest and Collymore sticks out his right foot to stop it and cops one right on the toe
Collymore back with a dot ball to end the over
slower ball, spotted by Vaughan who deposits it two thirds of the way to the cow-corner boundary
more aggression from Vaughan, hammered over midwicket  off the front foot and another four
yorker, dug out unconvincingly, the ball trickles a yard or so behind the stumps and Bopara calls his skipper through for a well-run single
dug in, hooked to deep backward square leg
pushed to mid-off who has dropped back to the edge of the circle ...they spotted that and ran the single
prodded to mid-on and another quick single called, but this one is not sensible and had Sarwan picked it up, Vaughan was gone
very well played, pulling this leg-side drifter around the corner
even better. Much too short and Bopara smacks this in front of square - on the front foot - with a great deal of authority, class and confidence
oh but he's beaten this time. A really clever little slower ball which bends, at the last moment, and Bopara completely misread it

Bopara played it neatly down the pitch and set off for a single; Simon Taufel did a little jig but couldn't quite get out of the way, parrying the ball to Samuels and Vaughan sent back Bopara had to dive for his ground
defended on the front foot
elegantly timed straight back...to the non-striker's stumps. Super timing

but it's much too short, much too wide, and all much of a muchness as Bopara swivel-pulls it round to short fine-leg. Bopara is made to hurry but the throw is wide and, what do you know? It goes for overthrows
short and rising, angled down past point
angled into the batsman who defends
an extravagant flick of the wrists down to fine leg
short of a length and he tries to pull, but misses, beaten by the bounce
bang! That's a Vaughan special, swivelling on this shorter ball and pulling it high and handsome into the midwicket stand. He creamed it
poor delivery, really, and Bopara flicks it off his hip, very calmly, down to the fine-leg fence
fuller and straighter, punched out to cover. Bopara roars "no"
a touch shorter, Bopara rocks back and punches it to the same cover fielder
squirted out to backward point but Bravo is there
really very well played off the back foot, smacking it on the up and timing it beautifully but not placing it
a slower ball which Bopara reads, slaps down the ground and they poach a single
pushed down to mid-off
a fabulous shot from Vaughan, skipping down the pitch and making it into a half-volley, dispatching it over long-on for an authoritative six
defended on the front foot
he again skips down the pitch but smudges it into midwicket
pushed through midwicket again
back into his crease, Vaughan flicks this to mid-on
flicks off his pads down to fine leg - really poor delivery but it's neatly, elegantly flicked
driven on the up, without sufficiently timing it, and Samuels drops it at cover, mistiming his jump and parrying it behind him
full, angling into the batsman - a touch of reverse swing there perhaps? - who can't break midwicket
hammered, absolutely laced on the front foot to cover
cut off the back foot behind point
outside off Bopara climbs into it but clobbers into the pitch
ah, deftly cut by Vaughan - a classy late-cut down to third man
driven without power to mid-off

that's a fine shot, cracking it square off the back foot, but it's brilliantly saved by Bravo at backward point. Oh and Bopara's going for a run but Bravo throws down the stumps - and hits, leaving Bopara comfortably short. Electric fielding from West Indies' best
just short of a length and Vaughan lunges forward, clattering this wider delivery to cover
close! Very close indeed as Vaughan goes back, attempts to cut but misses. Good bounce from Collymore there if a little too wide
ooh and Vaughan is hurried here, snapping his head out of the way of a bouncer
just short of a length, it jags into Pietersen who nudges it to leg
more inswing for Powell here who drives it back to him
absurd shot for a new batsman at the crease. A half-volley on off stump which he on-drives quite majestically, disdainfully for four
and he's onto the front foot again, cover-driving with ominous power but a short extra cover does very well to prevent the single
again Pietersen laces the ball to short extra, fairly hammering it, but the placement isn't there
a slower ball which is defended off the back foot out into the leg side
on leg stump, Vaughan is almost squared up here, trying to nudge it to leg but it bobbles out to the off side. Pietersen is quick to call him through for a single; Vaughan is less quick to take off
punched off the back foot to cover
an audacious attempt to flamingo-slap him through midwicket but he hits it straight to the man there and they pick up just a single
cut down to third man for another single
crunched to short extra cover, hitting it right on the top of the bounce but he can't place or time it
outside off stump, Pietersen flicks it to leg for a single
not a good ball, truth be told. A nothing sort of delivery down the leg side and Pietersen just works it through midwicket
a punched check-drive to cover
spearing into his stumps, Pietersen takes a step outside leg and strokes it to mid-on
on middle stump this time, but the angle is obtuse enough for Vaughan to knock it to a surprisingly deep mid-on for a single
a turn of the wrists hands him another run to fine leg
clonked back to the bowler
just short of a length (only a fraction) and Pietersen hungrily whips it to leg
flicked off his pads to midwicket
good line from the bowler, Vaughan stepping across to the off side but defends on the back foot
outside off and riding up onto Vaughan who takes advantage of the slipless field, deliberately edging it down to third man who has to run seven or eight metres to his left to prevent four
cutting back into Vaughan who chops it down for a quickie
a bouncer, Pietersen charges him and tries to flamingo-pull it but gets a top-edge which flies over the wicketkeeper's head for four. Madness
flicked through midwicket
driven to long-on
dropped into the off side for another single, albeit a hurried one
Pietersen waits, lets ball hit bat rather than other way round, and guides it into space on the off
driven to long-off, Pietersen looking for two, Vaughan having none of it
Pietersen steps out to meet the ball and flips it to long-on
leg-stump line, off the pads and it dribbles behind square as the batsmen walk the single
again on leg stump, swished round the corner to long leg. Powell's throw was right at the keeper's feet, real club 2nd XI stuff
patted to mid-off
clipped right at midwicket
Pietersen walks to meet the ball and flips it over midwicket - it just evaded the full-length leap by Taylor - and all the way to the rope

slower ball, outside off, Pietersen had stepped to leg and was through his shot early, he overbalanced and was out of his ground but Ramdin could not gather ... in fairness, it bounced in front of him.  Bravo drops to the ground in exasperation
clipped to short fine leg who pounces
checked drive to long-on
Pietersen waits and just turns the ball to midwicket, no pace but none needed
Vaughan steps back and pats the ball to deep square leg
dropped into the leg side, with this field it's harder to find the fielder than to evade him
steered towards point where there is another big gap
cut behind square, he was a bit cramped as that drifted in towards him
trademark Pietersen swish from middle-and-off, but he finds midwicket
dropped into the off side, no more than four yards, Pietersen set off but Bravo was alert and carried on without breaking stride to nip the single in the bud
slashed to backward point - it bounced just in front of Chanderpaul - and it bounced off him and so allowed the run
firm drive to long-off, played into the ground and over Bravo's outstretched hand
well worked to deep square leg, it was probably two anyway but the two fielders got in each others' way and so made the possibility a reality
full, perfect sweep and four all the way once he had beaten the man on the single
plopped into the leg side
looks to hit through midwicket but has to correct and ends up playing it back to Gayle
whipped square on the leg side
fullish, Vaughan pushes it to long-on to bring up the fifty partnership off 56 balls
driven back to Gayle with a shout of catch him.  Not even if they were playing one hand, one bounce would that have been a chance
slower ball outside off, Vaughan mistimes his square drive and it bobbles to point
cut from off stump to wide third man
Pietersen struggling for his timing ... this time he drives into his leg and the ball squirms out into the off a yard or so from him
steered with an open face to wide third man
quicker delivery, Vaughan drives back at Bravo who fields well ...it bounced kindly for him
slightly short, cut through where first slip's stomach would be, third man round quickly to field
loopy, outside off, not a hint of spin, and left alone
punched into the covers, Pietersen not remotely interested even though Vaughan was

cut to backward point, Vaughan was off for the single but Bravo picked up and scored a direct hit at the striker's end. The third umpire was called for but Vaughan, who wasn't even in the frame, wasn't hanging around and was back in the hutch by the time the decision came
cracked to mid-on and well p[cked up
lobbed up and blocked with soft hands
pushed a few yards into the off side
full, pushed to mid-on
driven with no real power to mid-off and Dwayne Smith, on for Marlon Samuels, lets it through his legs. Hopeless and he must have felt ten pairs of eyes staring at him after that
blocked into the off side
drifted into Collingwood who met it with bat and pad jammed together
pushed very gently to point who slowly bends to pick it up
Collingwood dead bats back to Bravo
worked to long leg
full toss, punched to long-off
steered to Bravo at backward point and Pietersen slow to set off. He made it but Bravo again threw down the stumps and the bowler's end
pushed to cover and more frantic calling ends up with no run being attempted
swished to long leg
looks to swing to leg and manages to get the ball to backward point. That's not easy
patted back to the bowler
outside off, Collingwood attempts to cut the ball but bottom-edges into his stumps. Bravo wheels away airplane-like while Collingwood looks accusingly at the pitch. Nothing wrong with the surface ...
full toss, patted uppishly to mid-off. Bravo yells "Catch it" but that was never a chance
off the mark with an easy single into the off
drifted in from outside off, driven to mid-on
again unable to find the gap on the leg side
ooh an outside edge from Flintoff, not the first time we've seen that this tournament, and it races down to third man
pushed out to cover
pushed out to cover
lovely late cut but he finds point
a big lunge from Flintoff, planting his size 19s, and it's timed neatly down to long-on

very wide, Pietersen slaps it into the deep for Smith to field who once again makes a hash of it, a real mess...casually waiting for the ball as though he has all the time in the world then, when it did roll into his hands, it fumbled it. England sneaked an extra run
a bouncer which gets big on a Flintoff pull, and it comes off his glove, bobbling out to Ramdin's left who makes reasonable ground but fails to dive. "Why no dive?" cries Tony Cozier. More sloppiness
stroked down the ground
big, steady, heavy power from Flintoff, short-arm pulling it through midwicket. No stopping that
hammered back to Bravo who fields in his follow-through and, quite brilliantly, throws the ball back to Ramdin in a blink of an eye
pushed to cover and they scamper for a single
crunched square to Chanderpaul at point
just short of a length and cut into the covers
worked for a single to leg
just outside off, Flintoff comes forward to defend
far too short and it's hammered off the back foot to deep extra cover
driven down to long-on for a single
and he launches into a cover drive, driving it rather uppishly and they pick up two
poor delivery down the leg side, clipped to fine-leg
ooh again Flintoff drives this uppishly, just short of mid-off. Bravo shouts "catch it" but it fell just short
down on one knee, Flintoff hammers it square to point
this time he takes a step just outside leg but again it's a dot ball as he finds mid-off
another crashing drive into the off side but just for a single to deep extra
Pietersen stands tall and clips it to long-on for an easily jogged single
and he comes down the pitch, casually driving it to mid-on
oh dear. The kiss of death from Will as Flintoff flicks it - nothing more than a casual pluck to Powell at mid-on
cut down to third man
dabbed back to the bowler
cut to point off the back foot
wide of the off stump and it's swept around the corner for a single
a good ball shaping back into him and it's pushed back to the bowler
just outside off, cut hard to Chanderpaul who is lightning quick and prevents a run
ever so slightly shorter, Dalrymple tries to come forward but doesn't really show much conviction in the stroke, crashing it back to the bowler
drifting down the leg side, it's worked to midwicket but a packed leg side field prevents a single
firmly on-driven to Devon Smith - straight to him, in fact - who threw down the stumps. A terrible, clueless run from Dalrymple and Smith, well, he had three stumps to aim at and hit middle. Easy.
swinging into Pietersen who times it to mid-on and doesn't set off for a run
immediately off the mark with a clip to leg. Super piece of leg clipping in fact
there we go. A crunching, crashing drive; half a step outside leg and he just cracked it through covers, threading the gap expertly
ah well bowled, a slower ball which is defended out to the off and they grab a single
pushed to point, but straight to point
worked around the corner for a single
and he does keep the strike, stroking this easily out to long-on for the simplest of singles
on the up, Pietersen crashes it through extra cover but without timing it sufficiently
timed to cover. "Yep," calls Pietersen
on leg stump, Nixon plucks it to short midwicket, shouts no, before setting off for a run - leaving the fielder bemused. Nixon then dives to make his ground
angling across Nixon who's rapped on the pads. Half a shout for lbw but it's going well over his off stump
pushed back to the bowler
pitches this outside leg and, as Nixon tries to work it through midwicket, he's beaten by the swing and rapped on the pads. An optimistic shout for lbw is rightly turned down
fantastic shot from him here, on-driving it - a straight flaming-flick is probably more accurate - past the bowler for four
and he tries to flick through midwicket but just can't quite time it this time
gives himself a touch of room and creams it to cover - times it too well, in fact, because he wants two. Smith out in the deep is a little slow, but Nixon would've been out had the throw hit
disdainfully, arrogantly smacked to mid-off but Pietersen rejects the single to retain the strike
oh blimey, Pietersen steps outside off stump and flicks it short of mid-on. Got himself into a bit of a tangle there
and he does defend, off the back foot, so Pietersen will have another over to face
another cracking shot from Pietersen, giving himself a bit of room and hammering it to deep extra cover. Collymore isn't the quickest around the boundary but does well to prevent four
ooh, pulled with immense power just short of a wide mid-on
Pietersen runs at the bowler, working it to mid-on for a single
Nixon steps down the pitch and drops this down into the off side, cleverly, and they pick up a single

Pietersen tries to loft this for six but almost pulls out of the stroke, dangerously so, and the ball drops just over the bowler's head. In fact he was probably beaten there by a slightly slower delivery
extraordinary stroke. Nixon stood tall, elevated his bat like a periscope and turned the ball around the corner with a flick, rather like a hook but without the shoulder movement
Nixon does well here, nudging it into the gap at midwicket and they set off for two which they get quite easily in the end, though the throw from midwicket hits the stumps
defended out into the off side
excellent delivery, a Bravo slower ball which loops into Nixon, foxing him, and rapping him on the pads. Pitched outside leg though...
this one keeps low just outside off and Nixon plays and misses
he skips down the pitch looking to drive it straight before opening the face of the bat to guide it out to deep extra cover. Chanderpaul, it is, on the boundary
ah but it's too wide of the leg stump; rightly wided
Bravo is furious with himself here, sending down a full toss to which Pietersen throws his hands and gets a very thick (and deliberate) outside edge down to third man for four
edged fine of the wicketkeeper down to third man
pushed back to the bowler
that is stunning from Pietersen - just so clever. A firm lunge onto the front foot and he just guides it off the outside edge down to third man for four
oh dear, don't bowl down the leg side to Pietersen. It's just flicked for four past the short fine leg
off his pads for a single
clunked on the front foot back to the bowler
full bunger which Pietersen strokes down to long-on
turned off his hip for a single
very wide of the off stump and Pietersen scrabbles desperately at it, somehow reaching it and getting enough on it to send it down to third man
crunched on the front foot to long-off
pushed back to the bowler
short of a length and Nixon pulls it calmly through midwicket, without ever looking to hammer it, and they scamper through for two
picked off his pads for a couple to deep midwicket
he goes to drive this straight down the pitch but the bat twists in his hand, the ball hammering into the inside of his knee. Thus, he hobbles
Nixon works it to leg easily for a single
a smite to Lara at deep midwicket whose throw is wide of the stumps
worked off his pads
swinging into his leg stump and he smudges it to leg
fullish, outside off and cracked to deep extra with clean timing
and there's the reverse sweep to short third man, Sarwan - who inexplicably fails to react, the ball falling short of him. He really could've dived
my word, Pietersen swings and misses, and does keeper and the ball runs fine and is picked up by fine leg
timed to midwicket
flicked down to fine leg
timed down the ground
slow half-volley, hammered down the ground and Bravo at long-off fields it on the bounce, right back on the rope
again a slightly slower ball, clubbed wide of long-on, Bravo round but Pietersen turned, was always coming back for two and made it with something to spare

driven to Gayle at mid-on, the batsmen both ended up in the middle of the pitch, Gayle fumbled and that allowed Pietersen to dive full-length at the striker's end to make his ground. Gayle could have had Nixon at the other end had he wanted
slower ball, Pietersen launches that over midwicket and the man in the deep can't get round in time
pushed to mid-on, Lara picks up and shies at the bowler's end but misses with Pietersen just about home
short, Nixon swings and misses, a massive cheer for a dot ball at last
a decent enough delivery, Pietersen steps to leg and hammers the ball into orbit over long-on. What a way to bring up his fifth ODI hundred and the crowd stand to applaud.
another big heave, but Taylor fire in a full delivery on and it crashes into the leg stump
on leg stump, Plunkett misses, it hits him on the pads and Taylor sprints down the track to field a yard from the batsman. And all that after an 86mph delivery
crashed through extra cover, deep cover has a lot of ground to make up and the batsmen come back for an easy second
slower ball - 71mph - Plunkett underclubs and Bravo, five yards in from the long-on boundary, waits and takes a good catch above his head
Nixon waits and steers the ball to third man to keep the strike
slower ball ...  but a full toss ... Nixon on it quickly and he cracks that over midwicket and there's a big gap out there
Nixon swings, misses, and the ball shaves the off stump
Nixon again heaves that over midwicket - he did well to fetch that from off stump - and Bravo cannot get round in time from long-on
a great shot, he came down the pitch and hit that, with mainly bottom hand, into the same area as the previous two fours but that was really clobbered and it sailed first bounce over the rope
short, Nixon swished and missed, Ramdin leapt but could only get his fingertips to it
pulled to deep square leg
squeezed down to third man, the man in the deep races in to prevent a second
short, Broad swats it over midwicket and, to loud cheers, runs the single
on leg stump, almost a yorker, Nixon flicks it off his feet and the ball shoots past the man behind square on the leg
Nixon drives to long-on
full toss, Broad calmly punches it down the ground to long-on
down the leg side, a distinct noise and Ramdin and Taylor let rip with a beseeching appeal but Rudi Koertzen shakes his head. Thigh pad?
full, dug out by Broad and punched to long-off. No thoughts of a second at this stage, especially as it puts Nixon on strike
anyone with a weak heart, turn off now. Slower ball fools Nixon who was on the walk as Bravo let go, he misses and it clips the top of his off stump
fired in at Anderson's legs, it hits him on the pads and as Bravo screams his appeal the batsmen run a leg-bye. That was several inches outside leg
slower ball, pushed into the off side and Gayle in lithely to field

Broad leans back and hits that high over the covers ... there's nobody back and that's the winning runs. Broad grins and embraces Anderson as the crowd erupts. A grim-looking Lara shakes hands with friends and foes and has a long handshake and exchange with Koertzen. The crowd stand as he heads off ahead of all the other players. He wipes a tear from his eye and shakes hands with the England side who have lined up on the boundary edge ... and then he disappears into the pavilion.
